intro: Rubia angustifolia var. caespitosa, commonly known as narrowleaf woodruff, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, often丛生 (clumped) growth habit and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant produces a distinctive blue-black fruit, which contains several tiny seeds. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
